text: Differential recruitment of <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and C / EBP-betaT217 to the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in vivo .
Transcription factor occupancy on the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter in vivo was determined by chromatin immunoprecipitation ( ChIP ) assay .

RAW264.7 macrophages were treated in the presence or absence of LPS for the indicated times and chromatin immunoprecipitation performed using antibodies against <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> p-C/EBP-beta (T217) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Soluble chromatin ( 600-700 ng ) was immunoprecipitated with antibodies against <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p-C/EBP-beta (T217) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , RNA Polymerase II ( RNAPII ) , or a rabbit IgG ( rIgG ) control .

( A ) Typical PCR pattern obtained in ChIP assays using murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter - specific primers , 338 / -315 and -5 / +19 , as diagrammed in top .
Recruitment of RNAPII to the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter suggests active transcription following LPS stimulation .
Minimal background was detected using the rabbit IgG control , indicative of the specificity of the ChIP reaction .

( B ) qPCR analysis of chromatin immunoprecipitated with antibodies against <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p-C/EBP-beta (T217) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and the rIgG control .
The data are represented relative to <extra_id_0> rIgG <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signal using the 2-deltadeltaCt method .
